'''WARNING''': This is a description of my experience with the pre-alpha package, this is not a howto or a guide, your experience may be entirely different from mine.

=== What I did in a nutshell ===

* Installed Ubuntu 5.04 Hoary Hedgehog
* Modified /etc/apt/sources.list changed:
 <pre>
deb-src http://za.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu hoary main restricted
</pre>

to

 <pre>
deb-src http://za.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy main restricted
</pre>
* apt-get dist-upgrade
* apt-get install ltsp-server-standalone
* Fixed breezy X problem

Copied the following files from a hoary system to the same location into the breezy system:

 <pre>
/usr/bin/X11/mkfontdir
/usr/bin/X11/mkfontscale }}}

Then I ran:

 {{{
mkfontdir /var/lib/defoma/x-ttcidfont-conf.d/dirs/CID
</pre>

* This is my dhcpd.conf file:
 <pre>
default-lease-time            60;
max-lease-time                600;
ddns-update-style none;
allow booting;
allow bootp;

option subnet-mask            255.255.255.0;
option broadcast-address      192.168.0.255;
option routers                192.168.0.254;
option domain-name-servers    192.168.0.254;
option domain-name            "ltsp";
option root-path              "/opt/ltsp/i386";
option option-128 code 128 = string;
option option-129 code 129 = text;
option option-211 code 211 = text;

shared-network WORKSTATIONS {
  subnet 192.168.0.0 netmask 255.255.255.0 {
     range dynamic-bootp 192.168.0.100 192.168.0.200;
     use-host-decl-names       on;
     option log-servers        192.168.0.254;
     option option-211	       "tftp";
     next-server 192.168.0.254;
     filename "/ltsp/pxelinux.0";
     }
}
</pre>

* Then I ran:
 <pre>
ltsp-build-client
ifconfig eth0 192.168.0.254
/etc/init.d/dhcp3-server start [started ok]
/etc/init.d/nfs-kernel-server restart [failed]
rm /etc/default/portmapper
/etc/init.d/nfs-kernel-server restart [started ok]
</pre>
